Title: Risk Analyst
Description: ** *  The Risk Analyst focuses on the management of incidents and claims at BYU and the other CES institutions, as well as additional tasks related to risk identification and risk control processes. Key duties include utilizing and being proficient with incident and claims reporting processes; performing incident/claim investigations, tracking, and follow-up; communicating with internal and external stakeholders or affiliates regarding claim status; identifying and implementing corrective actions and loss reduction strategies; and providing data analytics to document department and university performance and trends. Additionally, the Risk Analyst will be familiar with BYU’s insurance portfolio and will understand how to assist with legal document reviews, risk assessments, etc. *  Essential Functions*   *   Oversee incident and claims reporting tools and serve as the department subject matter expert on these systems: *     *      Ensure incidents and claims are timely reported utilizing the proper system. *      Ensure incidents and claims are recorded timely and accurately. This requires establishing processes for timely review and disposition of all incidents and claims in coordination with Church Risk Management and/or its claims administrator.*      Train department and BYU personnel on incident/claim reporting processes and expectations.*      Suggest process improvements and policy changes to the Risk Management Director. *      *   Manage incidents and claims: *     *      Screen all reported incidents to determine if there is need to investigate or take other action. *      As needed, perform incident investigations, and gather factual information for property, auto, liability, and other incidents and claims. *      Assist and/or coordinate significant incident investigation and incident management with the Risk Management Director. *      Communicate with claimants and university personnel regarding claim status and resolution.*      *   Provide Data Analytics: *     *      Create incident/claim reports which can be utilized to bring awareness to performance (i.e., positive, and negative trends). *      Create quarterly and annual Risk Management and Safety Department reports. *      Create any additional reports as requested by department or other university personnel. *      *   Coordinate and Assist in Risk Assessment and Mitigation Efforts: *     *      Identify corrective actions to prevent re-occurrence or minimize loss. Work with campus departments to implement these corrective actions. *      Assist with, or conduct, risk assessments of university units or programs, including assessing prior incident/claim information, performing physical inspections, interviewing personnel, etc.*      *   Additional Duties: *     *      As needed, assist in review and approval of special events and activities. This includes performing a review to identify risks and required mitigations for event and activity approval (e.g., release of liability waivers). *      Serve as the Risk Management/Fire and Life Safety representative at special events and activities as needed. *      Be familiar with BYU’s insurance portfolio. Be knowledgeable of available coverage. Request certificates of insurance or provide proof of coverage as needed. *      Supervise ½-time and student employee(s) to accomplish the above tasks and assignments. *      *   *  Education/Experience*   Minimum education/experience required: *  Professional designation or certification related to risk management, claims management, safety, loss control, etc. (e.g., Certified Insurance Counselor, Certified Risk Manager, Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter, Associate Risk Manager, Associate in Claims, Automobile Claim Law Associate, Senior Claim Law Associate) OR a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Administration, Insurance, Risk Management, Business, or related field and 5 years of related work experience OR the equivalent combination of education and experience. *   Preferred:*  Professional designation or certification related to risk management, claims management, safety, loss control, etc. (e.g., Certified Insurance Counselor, Certified Risk Manager, Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter) AND Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Administration, Insurance, Risk Management, Business, or related field *   10+ years of related work experience*   Skills, abilities, knowledge, licenses, certifications (required):*  Knowledge of principles and practices of risk management activities such as risk identification/reduction, loss control, asset protection, employee safety, workers’ compensation programs, etc. *   Knowledge of legal and insurance terminology and procedures *   Report preparation skills *   Written and verbal communication skills *   Time management skills *   Ability to identify and control risk *   Ability to apply sense of perspective and balance *   Ability to maintain confidentiality *   Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills *   Ability to manage multiple priorities and task with frequent interruptions *   Ability to communicate, interact and work effectively and cooperatively with all people including those from diverse ethnic and educational backgrounds *   Ability to conduct research, collect and analyze data and prepare written and oral reports *   Experience preparing spreadsheets and/or utilizing a risk management information system*  *   Employee Class: AdministrativeWork Location: Provo CampusEnvironment: Rare presence of abnormal variations in temperature and exposure to outside conditionsDesired Start Date: As soon as possibleJob Close Date: 09/02/2022Pay Level: 53Approximate Starting Salary: $64,000 to $83,000 (DOQ)Documents Required at time of Application: Required: Cover Letter, Resume Optional: Letter of Recommendation 1Members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints must hold and be worthy to hold a current temple recommend.Brigham Young University is an equal opportunity employer, including disability and protected veteran status.Brigham Young University recognizes the benefits of attracting and retaining a diverse workforce. We strive to create a welcoming workplace that promotes a sense of inclusivity and belonging.* *

In this role, data structures and architectures will be developed and utilized to increase velocity in the factory, improve handoffs, reduce lead times and improve performance to standard work for the shop floor and back office processes.*  *   This job requires understanding what data needs to be collected, how to implement collection and analysis at the speed of relevance, using both manual and automated data collection methods. The position will be located on the production floor to ensure accuracy and integrity of the data and data collection methods.*  *   Ability to create production system data collection architectures, rather than tend*  *   Knowledge, Skills and Ability*   Complete understanding and wide application of technical principle, theories, and concepts in the field. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives.*  *   Impact*   Contributes to the completion of specific programs and projects. Represents the organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects.*  *   Requirements*   STEM degree – Industrial Engineering degree preferred with 2 years experience*    Demonstrated ability to interface with operational, technical and other support roles to facilitate problem solving and improve communication and understanding of problems.*    Demonstrated business acumen*    Strong problem solving skills.*    High communication skills, including the ability to facilitate cross-functional problem solving groups.*    Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance*  *   Preferred*   Active DoD Secret clearance with a reinvestigation date occurring in the last 5 years.*    Experience in production system transformations*    Experience in Lean Agile methodologies*  * *  Salary Range: $78,300 USD - $117,500 USD* * *  Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Description: ** *  Job Description:* * * *   3M HIS Natural Language Understanding Engineer – REMOTE USA* * * *   Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World* * *   Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. NLU-related issues and generally improve our NLU*   Able to work independently as well as part of the team, depending on the problem at hand* * *   Your Skills and Expertise*   To set you up for *   OR* *  High School Diploma/GED or higher from a (completed and verified prior to start) and six (6) combined years of experience in software or linguistics* *  Two (2) years of experience in a documentation* * *   Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:* *  Degree in Linguistics or Computational Linguistics Knowledge of UNIX/Linux operating systems, development environments and tools*   Good knowledge of regular expressions*   Must be a team player and have strong written and verbal communication skills*   Experience with GitHub (merge / resolve conflicts) or other version control*   Experience with XML*   Experience with AWS*   While coding will not be the primary task for this position, sufficient Java and Python knowledge for reading and understanding code, as well as making feature changes when needed, is necessary to be successful in this position* * *   Travel: <5%* * *   Relocation Assistance: May be authorized* * *   Location: Remote USA* * * *   Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).* * * *   Supporting Your Well-being* * *   3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.* * * *   Resources for You* * *   For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.* *  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.*  Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.*  Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Capstone IT is assisting our client to find a self-driven, Senior Business Analyst/Report Writer. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of business and data analysis with a deep knowledge of SQL, SSRS and data modeling. In this role you will lead and own data analytics, while working with teams across the business. Join a company that values work life balance and family, while achieving growth and excellence!*RESPONSIBILITIES*Engage a variety of stakeholders across the business to understand data and business needs.*Execute analyses and iterate and refine with business stakeholders.*Analyze source system data and profile data using SQL and BI Tools*Create visually appealing reports and dashboards per the needs of the business.*Work with users to understand their requirements and use your technical acumen to translate them into technical requirements and implement them.*REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS*5+ years of strong hands-on SQL coding experience for querying and data analysis.*4+ years working knowledge of data and dimensional modeling.; esp. star schemas*Strong analytical and quantitative skills required*Strong technical skills with the ability to work with various data sources (SQL Server, SSRS). Proficiency with MS Office required.*Ability to work with SQL Server stored procedure and build reports using SSRS required. Knowledge of SSIS packages and SSAS cubes desired*Experience using ETL tools to develop ETL packages, experience with SSIS preferred*Strong attention to detail.*Sound understanding of Business Intelligence best practices, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, data warehouse and reporting techniques.*Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills*Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field is required*PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE*Experience with Agile processes*Experience architecting BI tool projects and dashboards.*Experience with ETL*Experience building analytics solutions using Python or R.* 4+ years of report/dashboard design and development experience using BI tools such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, or Microsoft Power BI*Job Type: Full-time*Pay: $110,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year*Benefits:*401(k)* 401(k) matching* Dental insurance* Health insurance* Paid time off* Parental leave* Retirement plan* Vision insurance*Schedule:*Monday to Friday*Ability to commute/relocate:*Draper, UT 84020: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)*Experience:*SQL (complex queries, inner/outer joins, stored procedures): 6 years (Required)* Report/Dashboard Design: 4 years (Required)* SSRS: 4 years (Required)* SSIS: 2 years (Required)*Work Location: One location

Title: Sr. Data Analyst, Account Acquisition Strategy
Description: Merrick Bank employees share in our mission to delight our customers and empower underserved consumers to achieve their credit goals. In return, we delight our associates; ensuring they are noticed, heard, appreciated and understand the importance of their role(s). For over 20 years, our Guiding Principles of; doing the right thing, putting the customer first, and Earn, Learn, Have Fun (aka E.L.F.), have defined who we are as an Employer of Choice. Give Yourself Credit, Work at Merrick!*Employer:  Merrick Bank Corporation*Location of Employment:  10705 South Jordan Gateway, Suite 200, South Jordan, UT 84095*Job Title:  Senior Data Analyst*Job Duties: *Run multiple monthly processes using analytical and statistical software tools: Statistical Analysis System (SAS), R, or SQL extract.* Maintain and govern Terabytes of data feeds related to the origination process provided by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA) analytical and statistical software tools.* Manage internal data: flat files, SAS datasets, and relational SQL tables related to the credit card originations process.* Perform prospect selection process and audit.* Execute the code base and make modifications as necessary for program changes.* Execute detailed programming specifications to create monthly credit card prospecting lists for direct mail, online offers, and email offers.* Perform data analysis and validate the accuracy of data received from various data sources and analyze around 160 million record files using a variety of SAS procedures like MACROS, PROC TABULATE, PROC UNIVARIATE, PROC FREQ and many more.* Improve current processes through automation using LaTeX.* Maintain/update analytical files and data sources using MSSQL, PostgreSQL, or Greenplum databases.* Update several Key Performance Indicators (KPI) including delinquency rate, charge-off rate, debt to income ratio, monthly income, risk score, and response score.* Create a list of solicited new accounts for the Bank’s monthly campaign using Data Warehousing, ETL (Extract Transform Load), Business Analytics, R Scripting, SAS Macros, Tableau/Domo.* Work with senior managers to provide business intelligence reports and tables to understand the business more deeply using BI tools such as Shiny (R), Domo, Tableau, or Dash (Python).* Create audits SAS and Business Intelligence tools containing complex statistics to make simple tables that are easier for internal and external parties involved.* Creating complex reports that gather hundreds of gigabytes of data.* Document logic and assumptions used in the report generation.* Find issues with data and present work product to executives from credit risk, marketing, data science, and business analytics.* Document all data and processes the department develops and utilizes.* Comply with banking industry laws and regulations using knowledge of the banking industry, specifically credit cards and risk analytics.* Comply with all of internal control policies and procedures.* Perform business intelligence and analytical reporting using business understanding and critical thinking.*Degree Requirement:  Master’s Degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Data Science, Information Systems, Accounting or closely related field. Foreign Degree accepted.*Experience Required:  Two (2) years as a Data Analyst with a financial institution, insurance firm, consulting firm, or healthcare company.*Skill set Requirements (Special Requirements): Demonstrable knowledge of and prior experience in: *SQL* SAS object-oriented programming* Data Warehousing, ETL, Business Analytics, R Scripting, SAS Macros, Tableau/Domo,* Manipulating and transforming large files 5 million+ rows using SAS,.* Creating complex reports that gather hundreds of gigabytes of data.* MSSQL, PostgreSQL, or Greenplum databases.* BI tools such as Shiny (R), Domo, Tableau, or Dash (Python)* Writing automated reports with LaTeX.*Travel Requirements:  None.*Work Hours:  8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m., Monday – Friday.*Only qualified applicants need apply. Do not apply if you are an H-1 or F-1 visa holder, or if you otherwise require employer sponsorship to obtain U.S. employment authorization. Do not apply if you are not eligible to be employed in the U.S.*Who is Merrick Bank? Founded over 20 years ago, Merrick Bank is a FDIC-insured Utah Industrial Loan Bank that originates loans with the benefit of low-cost deposit funding. Merrick Bank had $4.5 billion in assets and $3.1 billion in deposits as of March 31, 2021. Merrick Bank operates four main business lines: Credit Cards, Recreation Lending, Personal Loans and Merchant Acquiring.*Our Valued Employees are provided generous benefits, including:*Competitive Pay* Benefits Package -Medical, Dental and Vision (plus much more)* 401(k) Plan with Company Match* Short & Long Term Disability* Group Life and AD&D Insurance* Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days* Employee Events, including Employee Appreciation Day, Holiday Party, etc.* Tuition Reimbursement Program*Candidates must have unrestricted authority to work in the United States without sponsorship.*Merrick Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristic.Merrick Bank will do a thorough background check for all hires. The EEOC Law poster is available here: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm Please go to our website www.merrickbank.com to apply and learn more about our company.*Job Type: Full-time

Title: Remote Senior Data Scientist NLP
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT 84111
Description: * Company Summary* *  Join a team that puts its People First! As a member of First American’s family of companies, Data & Analytics is a national provider of property-centric information, analytics, risk management and valuation solutions. First American maintains and curates the industry’s largest property and ownership dataset with over 7 billion document images. Our major platforms and products include: DataTree®, FraudGuard®, RegsData™, TaxSource™ and ACI®. The First American Data & Analytics division boasts more than 20 patents and remains at the forefront of innovation - leveraging technology and data to deliver best-in-class decisioning solutions. Fueled by our industry-leading data and using our technology and proprietary process, our solutions provide lenders, real estate and title companies with actionable insights - enabling them to make better, increasingly automated, decisions. With offices in all major metropolitan areas, including California and New York, DNA teams work collaboratively from across the country. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for seven consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.* *  Job Summary* * *   Remote Candidates Welcome!!* * * *  *   *    *      We have an exciting role for a Data Scientist to help build and solve some of the most unique, interesting and challenging questions related to Natural language processing (NLP) utilizing a variety of Machine learning and deep learning techniques within Artificial Intelligence. The role will present opportunities to work on large datasets and the ability to use innovative techniques in Artificial Intelligence ranging from various NLP methods, computer vision, and deep learning to enable solutions that will be directly impactful to our customers. The solutions that you will POC, obtain feedback, quickly turnaround, iterate, story tell and integrate the model in a production pipeline will be a key success criterion for this position. You will completely own and manage the solution and collaborate with key product groups to provide innovative ideas and solution that are impactful and add immediate value.*     *      Responsibilities *     Use consultative approach to understand business problems and build solutions in an iterative manner.*       Works with product teams to identify opportunities for Machine learning Deep learning and computer vision models to enable key success criteria.*       Perform end to end activities within the data science life cycle from business problem understanding, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, model training, model evaluation, visualization and deployment.*       Within an NLP problem able to design and implement all components of the solution starting from understanding the data set, document balance, modern tokenization techniques and utilize deep learning models and tune model parameters to achieve optimal model scores.*       Utilize Machine learning to identify pattern and anomaly in data sets.*       Proactively research, prototype and present ideas to senior management in areas of machine learning, deep learning and computer vision that are directly beneficial and impactful to business use cases.*       Participate and mature the data science framework with industry leading tools like Azure ML best practices and community of learning.*     *      Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used*      Experience with state-of-the-art techniques within NLP and utilized transformer based models and tokenization schemes for NLP tasks.*       NLP project experience using pytorch, tensorflow, FASTai, spacy, huggingface transformers models.*       Coding experience with several languages like Java Script, Python,, etc.,*       Very good experience of querying databases (SQL)*     *      Typical Education*      BS or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science*       MS or PhD degree preferred*      Typical Range of Experience*      5-7 years of related work experience building predictive and descriptive statistical models*     *     #LI-CG2*      #DNAIT*    *   *  * * *  Disclaimer*  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal work hours and/or responsibilities from time to time, as needed.* *  First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.* *  Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.*

Title: Machine Learning Ops/DevOps Engineer
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * At TripActions, "It's all about the user. All of them." We're passionate about providing a seamless one-stop experience for business travelers, no matter how they travel, where they stay, or where they're going. *  TripAction is looking for a Machine Learning Ops/DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. You will be working within our world-class data organization to help modernize and scale our data platform to power our data-driven company and to support our rapidly evolving and growing data needs. You will get an opportunity to improve our existing data infrastructure and to design, build and maintain the ML deployment process and pipeline. The ideal candidate will be extremely curious and will use their data skills and business mindset to make a difference every day. We are looking for people who can operate at a company that grows as fast as ours by dealing with multiple moving pieces while still holding up quality, long-term thinking, and delivering value to our customers. We take great pride in our diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives and we strongly believe this is helping us to grow as a successful and impactful team. *  What You'll Do: * Continuously improve our data infrastructure to make it more stable, scalable, observable and secure *  Support services running in production (we are looking for true owners) *  Work on design and implementation of the new MLOps architecture *  Work closely with the data science, product, and engineering terms to develop and deploy advanced ML models *  Collaborate with the Data Warehouse and BI team to assist them in automation of their processes *  Develop our internal tooling library used by the data team *  Review and manage user access as well as create documentation to help the team follow the best practices * What We're Looking For: * BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related technical field *  3+ years of relevant work experience in Machine Learning, DevOps, or Data Engineering *  Fluent in Python, SQL, and Shell/Bash scripting *  Proficiency with deploying models via AWS SageMaker or MLFlow *  Experience in AWS and its core offerings (EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, Gateway API, etc) *  Experience in CI/CD pipeline implementation and tools like GitHub (including Workflows and Actions), Terraform, Docker, Jenkins, Blue Ocean, Circle CI *  Experience with columnar databases like Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery and ETL/ELT tools like Fivetran, Stitch, dbt, Airflow, etc*

Will be responsible for developing market intelligence and analysis to enhance the current E-Delivery product. Supporting NAM & global solution initiatives as necessary by creating Business Requirements Documents and performing project management tasks.Key responsibilities: *Be Daily Lead in supporting the product growth for E-Delivery as well as specific Maersk Sales verticals* Assist E-Delivery Product Managers in developing products/tools that leads to profitable growth opportunities with commercial stakeholders and drive implementation in line with commercial requirement together with key internal and external stakeholders* Support Head of E-Delivery Product Management with the execution of strategy to drive the profitable growth of E-Delivery Services in NAM* Actively promote NAM E-Delivery services offering across the organization and support, including market mapping/evaluation, competitive environment, target customers, pricing strategy, support/training to Sales*Requirements:*Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of 1-2 years of experience with market research and data analytics* Exceptional analytical skills, with strong understanding of data across multiple sources to drive fact-based decision making* Strong ability to manage complexity in analytical work, but able to promote simplification and communicate commercial direction* High degree of change readiness and energy to be able to continuously adjust to dynamic changes in our business environment and act as a change agent for our E-Delivery Value Added Services journey* Good stakeholder management and communication skills, able to gain credibility, engage, and motivate others to deliver on required actions and deliver Impact without Authority* Team-oriented and passionate about proactive collaboration with global colleagues across multiple functions and cultures* Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills in English* Political savvy; mature enough to work with senior leaders; can cope with high pressure* Highly motivated and self-driven* Excellent Microsoft Office skills including Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word*Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description: * The Data Analyst will provide the department with reliable data from trusted source systems that will empower and influence key decision making. The incumbent will suggest improvements to processes. The incumbent will initiate queries on the database using different manipulations to obtain the information needed. Much of the data this position works with is of a sensitive nature and must be safeguarded. The demands of this position require the incumbent to have an intuitive understanding of the systems worked with, including legal processes, and the ability to develop innovative solutions to complex problems. This position’s customers demand timely and accurate data. *  Contract Worker assignments may include providing the following deliverable[s]: *  Manual and automated work in existing and future systems for:*   Implementation of Contract Management System *    Classification of 17,000 contracts and assignment of RVNs *    Automating process and completing reviews of large amounts of data *   * Incumbent may also be asked to participate in contract and compliance administration activities as described below. *  Responsibilities﻿ * Conducts analysis of database and information for legal research purposes. *  Ensures the accuracy of the information received, validates data quality, including sources, reliability completeness, validity and uniqueness to maintain the integrity of the process. *  Channels the data to where it is needed, builds queries, and completes Quality Assurance. *  Builds data and reports that enables business leader to make informed decisions. *  Restructures data into usable formats (Excel, Pdf files, etc.) for customers. *  Interfaces with work team to ensure that everyone understands database processes to complete their work assignments. *  Assists in database content, interrelationships on database, interpretation of reports, and so forth. Incumbent must be highly technical. *  Ability to communicate with customers at their level about research results. *  High adaptability in a learning new tools and technologies *  Contract Worker may perform services for the annual FHD RootsTech event as needed. * Qualifications﻿ * Education and Work Experience: BS/BA Degree in Data Science or a related field plus a minimum 2+ years performing single system data validation, quality assessments, and configuration of reports OR no degree w/6 years’ experience performing single system data validation, quality assessments, and configuration of reports. *  Thorough knowledge of MS Word and MS Excel, including the full utilization of these tools.*   Must be able to create and manage data in Excel; from data lookups using the integrated APIs to complex formulas that intelligently summarize data. *    Must have practical experience using fields, content controls, styles, and languages in Word. *    Must be able to build VBA macros in both Word and Excel using the object model (not simply recorded macros). *   *  Has knowledge of database design principles. *  Understands ETL (Extract, Transform, Load). *  Knowledge of Regular Expressions (RegEx) is highly desirable. *  Has experience in business requirement gathering and process improvement analysis. *  Sees and understands the story the data tells. *  Works with minimal oversight and meets established deadlines. *  Must be a self-starter, especially someone who seeks to fully understand a process and then improve upon it through automation. *  Meticulous attention to detail and willingness to learn various legal concepts (previous legal experience not necessary). *  Delivers defined projects with moderate oversight. *  Can problem solve, debug/troubleshoot, design and implements solutions to complex issues. *  Thrives in both team environment and as an individual contributor. *  Manages time with competing priorities. * Worthiness Qualifications: *  Only members of the Church who are worthy of a temple recommend qualify for employment. Apart from this, the Church is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on any basis that would violate U.S. or local law. *  Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, color, gender, pregnancy, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other legally protected categories that apply to the Church. The Church will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities*

Title: Data Integration Analyst - SQL Specialist
Description: * At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always reexamining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology—and each other to surpass these boundaries—we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. * Pearson Virtual Schools (PVS) provide high-quality, highly accountable online education solutions to schools, school districts, and students in grades K-12. It serves families and schools with a variety of digital learning and online school solutions including Connections Academy, International Connections Academy, and Pearson Online Classroom. Recognized for its outstanding curriculum, high-quality teachers, and leadership, Pearson Virtual Schools is committed to expanding quality education through technology and helping students achieve both academic and personal success. * Position Summary: * Working remotely, the Data Integration Analyst - SQL Specialist will work with school staff, the technology team, and partners to accurately report student and staff data to state Departments of Education and Federal Government Agencies, as well as supply critical data to other departments within Pearson Online and Blended Learning K-12 including the Executive and Legal team. This is a newly created position with the opportunity to gather requirements, develop, communicate, and implement processes. The employee is responsible for anticipating, creating, organizing, updating, and maintaining the SQL queries and reports for the state reporting team. He/she will also prepare ad hoc reports requested by external audiences often requiring a short turnaround. The ideal candidate will have strong technical aptitude, a desire for continuous improvements, takes initiative, enjoys problem-solving, experience with project management, and school reporting as it relates to data manipulation, report writing, automation, importing, and exporting between applications. In addition, the candidate will be able to communicate effectively and confidently with state reporting colleagues as well as other corporate and school leaders. * Responsibilities: * Provide data to support the school's academic and financial operations for multiple complex schools; Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) data between systems. *  Manage data sets with students, staff, and course information. Partner with school personnel and program and district liaisons to monitor and track data for inconsistencies, research discovered inconsistencies, and develop a plan for correction and future prevention. *  Interpret technical file specifications, export, and import data to fulfill requirements, and document steps for replication and audit preparation. *  Manage deadline tracking systems and ensure timely submission of all required reports. *  Maintain data integrity and ongoing quality of delivered reports. *  Support cross-team requirements and development efforts for multiple projects. *  Create and maintain SQL Server Reports to accommodate state reporting and corporate requirements. *  Assist with developing procedures and oversee implementation of procedures for reporting to external audiences including state agencies, funding sources, school boards, partner organizations, etc. *  Represent PVS, the school, and the department at internal and external conferences including preparing and delivering presentations. *  Identify and lead opportunities for improvements to increase accuracy and efficiency. *  Serve as subject matter expert in data tools and techniques. *  Maintain departmental process and procedure documentation. *  Other duties as assigned. * Requirements: * Strong knowledge of SQL with experience querying large complex data models. *  Proven experience with report design and ability to present data in a meaningful way using Power BI, Reporting Services, and/or MS Excel *  Ability to interpret technical file specification documents to produce error-free import files *  Experience establishing procedures for data management and quality control *  Excellent communication skills, both oral and written including leading and owning the relationship with partner-customers and resolving conflicts *  Excellent project management, organizational, and planning skills with the ability to balance multiple tasks and competing deadlines *  Experience with Salesforce data structures *  4-8 years of professional experience *  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Math, Statistics, Education, Social Science, Research, or related field *  Due to the nature of this position, the applicant will need the ability to work from home or during off-hours as necessary. *  Experience in K-12 education and/or State educational reporting a plus * Capabilities: * Customer Centric – Acts with a strong customer mindset (both internal and external) and is a visible advocate for the customer. Builds strong partnerships with customers and uses those to improve their experience and outcomes. *  Delivering Financial Results – A strong track record of delivering against budgets and commitments. *  Communications - A great communicator who engages teams and stakeholders with thoughtful delivery and messages that resonate. *  Works well in a matrix - Models collaboration, solves problems with peers, builds trust and support. *  Takes personal responsibility – Can be relied on to complete tasks timely and well, demonstrates “ownership” regardless of the outcome, proactive in exploring and exploiting new opportunities. * Behaviors: * High level of integrity and transparency; *  Customer-centric mentality; *  High degree of flexibility; *  Positive attitude; *  Evidence of a strong work ethic, and; *  Demonstrated team player * Pearson Virtual Schools is focused on providing a flexible work environment to its employees, including the ability to work from home on a regular basis in most positions. We believe that flexibility in work/life balance is a critical part of our culture and employee satisfaction, and we are proud to provide our employees the ability to work from anywhere, anytime. In exchange, we require that employees have the appropriate means to work remotely, including adherence to our work-at-home policies regarding home office setup, including but not limited to privacy of records, technology standards, equipment standards, and expectations. * The following equipment will be provided to you by the company as a full-time employee: * Laptop *  Monitor *  Mouse *  Keyboard *  Headset * The following equipment will need to be provided by you, as the employee, when working from home: * 2nd monitor (required) * The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based expressing interested in this position is $63,000-$70,000. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are committed to being an anti-racist company in everything we do. We value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. Title: Data Science Manager - Research and Productization of ML/AI...
Description: * Data Science Manager - Research and Productization of ML/AI & Analytic Automation capabilities*  Deloitte Digital's Experience Management team combines software and services to help clients improve their data management and decisioning, delivering high value intelligence in real-time to every marketing and advertising channel.*  We're looking for a thought-leader and expert to fuel our continuing innovation and help us scale our team of talented data scientists.*  Work you will do as Data Science Manager*  This is a high-profile role in a well-funded team. You will have ownership of the directed research and productization of transformational ML/AI capabilities for large clients. You will combine leading ML/AI open source libraries and techniques to prototype the intelligent automation of cross-channel communications for large (multi-terabyte) clients. The data engineering team is then responsible for the coding of your team's proven prototypes into enterprise grade products for our large clients. We have a great team of machine learning experts, data scientists, infrastructure engineers and technical writers, all of whom are committed to delivering first class software for downstream clients. Our existing stack makes heavy use of the Python machine learning ecosystem, and assembles systems to deliver massive decisioning throughput, with tight latency constraints. Our solutions may be used to service specific enterprise client marketing and advertising performance needs, but are designed to support major ML/AI transformations that service large numbers of professional data engineers and data scientists in large enterprises. If you have deep experience in researching, prototyping, and validating machine learning processes and workflows in the marketing, customer experience or advertising spaces, then we want to hear from you!*  Your responsibilities will include:*  Reporting to the VP Engineering - ML/AI Analytic Automation, you will drive the research, data science vision and realization of that vision as practical productized applications by working closely with the Data Engineering team.*   Leading a team of 6-10 talented PhD and Masters Data Scientists with deep domain knowledge in statistical methods and ML/AI open source techniques and libraries.*   Evangelizing disciplined quantitative research, rigorous benchmarking and prototype ML/AI development within the firm, sometimes working closely with other teams delivering modern software assets*   Researching and developing enterprise grade machine learning automation capabilities that hugely reduce cost-per-output-decision, moving expensive human-driven decisions to lower cost and more performant machine-driven ones*   Working closely with our product team to guide the vision, roadmap and prototyping of ML/AI and statistical analytics related product components*   Coaching, motivating and inspiring less senior team members, and advising them on their career growth*   Representing the ML/AI and Analytic Automation capabilities and technologies to others in the broader team and across the firm*   Advising on functional requirements for the deployment of productized technology on client engagements*  Our Team*  You'll join an existing team of passionate, talented hybrid ML engineers and R&D data scientists and who collaborate to design, build and maintain cutting-edge machine learning solutions that provide our clients with real-time customer intelligence that controls interactions with consumers. If you're intellectually curious, hardworking and solution-oriented, you'll fit right into our fast-paced, collaborative environment.*  Qualifications and Experience, Skills and Qualifications*  A PhD or Masters in Data Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, Physics or other quantitative field*   10+ years of post-academic experience*   4+ years of experience overseeing the data science research and prototyping of analytic automation products, with evidence of successful outcomes*   An exceptional learned ability to really understand where the greatest commercial benefits may be realized from productized ML/AI automation activities.*   Excellent communication skills and an ability to explain complex subjects in simple language*   Good experience of modern Agile software development practices, coding in Python and operating in the major cloud environments (AWS, Azure and GCP) with cloud-native capabilities.*   Strong commitment to disciplined data science, rigorous performance benchmarking and high-quality software development*   Experience manipulating big data (terabytes) using common opensource frameworks*   A deep interest in Data Science ML/AI techniques and the evolving landscape. *  A creative and naturally curious intellect. *  Experience with distributed, high throughput and low latency architectures*   A history of good collaboration with DevOps and Project Managers to meet agreed project goals.*   Experience with large consumer data sets, and building productized analytic capabilities for improving customer experiences and increasing the marketing or advertising performance of large B-to-C enterprises is a major advantage.*   Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.*   Ability to travel up to 30%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve.*  #AHBV*

Title: Financial Analyst I
Description: * SUMMARY * The Finacial Analyst Team assists management in measuring key business objectives. These measures provide strategic insight and actionable outcomes for key decision makers to optimize the use of sacred resources.*  Define business requirements to be built in the Enterprise Data Warehouse.*   Become subject matter experts for assigned data stewardships.*   Serve as trusted business partners across the organization.*   Analyze data for actionable insights.*   Communicate findings clearly and effectively.*  RESPONSIBILITIES * Build dashboards and use visualization tools (i.e., Tableau, Power BI).*   Perform timely ad-hoc analyses that answer critical questions.*   Counsel stakeholders to define and scope analytical needs.*   Communicate complex data findings clearly and effectively.*   Become proficiently familiar with all available data sources, data structures, and metrics currently in use.*   Define requirements for data warehouse enhancements and improvements*   Monitor existing data feeds to verify there are no data outages in the reporting tools.*   Support other Business Intelligence team members in working on existing projects.*  QUALIFICATIONS * Work or educational experience in the following areas: Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Math, Statistics, Economics, Business Analysis, or any other analytical field.*   We are currently working towards or recently completed a college degree.*   We have advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel.*   Experience with or aptitude to become proficient with data visualization tools (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, SSRS, etc.).*   Ability to research and understand a customer's needs, problems, and potential constraints.*   Ability to work with minimal supervision and identify opportunities to provide value.*   Strong communication skills.*   Ability to present analytical findings in a group setting, including clearly explaining details, answering questions, and defending viewpoints.*

Title: Senior Learning Data Scientist
Description: * Who we are: * Our purpose is to add life to a lifetime of learning. We have more than 20,000 employees that deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. * This position sits within our Virtual Learning Business, specifically in Pearson Online Learning Services (POLS) Partner & Student Services/Learning Design Solutions (LDS), helping to support our various academic partner institutions in Higher Education. * Your role: * This position reports to the Director of Instructional Design and Development, under the direction of the Vice President for Partner and Student Services. You will be accountable for leading, optimizing and expanding learning analytics capabilities across learning design and student services, among other POLS functions dedicated to student success. This role will be responsible for contributing to POLS success in the following ways: * Lead learning analytics efforts across POLS portfolio and with new business; including developing personalized learning analytics strategies for partners and translating the needs of customers into appropriate data-informed solutions. *  Collaborate with cross functional teams of content developers, instructional designers, and business analysts to define and deliver on POLS learning analytics roadmap and support customer data needs *  Work closely with partner institutions as well as support internal initiatives with end-to-end research support, including working with key stakeholders to generate and test hypotheses *  Expand Pearson’s thought leadership in educational research and learning analytics through the publication of academic papers, conference presentations, and authoring white papers *  Support team efforts to become increasingly data-driven and establish a culture of data-informed decision making *  Mine large structured and unstructured educational data to glean actionable insights and make evidence-informed recommendations on how the data can be used to help solve business problems with direction *  Build data pipelines to extract, load, and transform educational data from multiple sources and then communicate this data in ways that meet the needs of the intended audience (e.g., dashboards and/or reports) *  Willingness to stay up to date on learning science research and ongoing advances in learning analytics methods to develop the next generation of learning analytics solutions * Your qualifications: * An advanced degree from an accredited institution with a doctoral-level degree strongly preferred *  5-8 years of experience in higher education, educational research, statistics, psychometrics, data science. *  Strong background in educational research and deep knowledge of key findings in the learning sciences. *  Extensive experience and expertise in analyzing behavioral and outcomes data from various platforms and systems; experience working with educational data sources (e.g., learning management systems, digital courseware) a plus. *  Proven ability to write academic papers and present research findings at conferences or in business engagements. *  Extensive knowledge and experience with database development, statistical techniques, data collection, data warehousing, data mining, data modeling, statistical modeling, predictive modeling, and data visualization. *  Extensive technical expertise in cloud-based technologies (AWS & Google Cloud), SQL, R, Python, JavaScript, Snowflake, Tableau Desktop & Tableau Server. Deep experience with analysis of unstructured data is critical. *  High business acumen, excellent ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terms. *  Problem-solving skills, willingness to learn new concepts and methodologies as needed, quickly, and apply them to new problem-solving scenarios. *  Proficiency with machine learning methods a strong plus. *  Ability to develop solutions that are innovative and scalable. *  Ability to work independently and collaboratively with stakeholders to drive action. *  Track record of influencing others in a constructive manner to build and sustain collaborative relationships *  A demonstrated ability to work remotely with minimal supervision (this is a remote-accessible position) under highly dynamic workloads with the ability to be highly effective while managing shifting internal expectations and priorities * While this position is remote-eligible, it includes the potential of up to 20% travel. As such, candidate proximity to a major airport is preferred. * As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Pearson provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $90,000.00 - 115,000.00 USD. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, and information on benefits offered can be found on our benefits website: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/ * Job: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT * Organization: Virtual Learning * Schedule: FULL\_TIME * Req ID: 7484**

Title: Data Analyst- Product
Description: * Healthcareâs helping hand.: *  CHG shook things up in 1979 by inventing the locum tenens staffing model. We connect doctors with patients who need their care. As the largest physician staffing firm in America, our providers treat millions of patients each year. * Our industry is growing and demand is high. This means you’ll have plenty of opportunities to grow and develop in your career. Keeping healthcare healthy can be as fun as it is rewarding.* * *   Product is looking for a Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics team. The Product Analytics team provides quantitative analysis, market expertise, and a strategic perspective to help prioritize our product features and roadmap. As a Product Analyst on the Product Analytics team you will be the analytics expert for your team. You will own the data analysis related to our products, develop a deep understanding of our customer behaviors, and provide a strong perspective about the health of our products. This role will report to Director of Product Analytics.*  Your role:: * Develop a deep understanding of the customer journey through our internal CRM and make recommendations to improve onboarding, adoption, conversion, retention, etc.*   Partner with Product Manager and Product Delivery to establish success metrics for our products and build dashboards showing progress towards those metrics*   Provide data analysis to help Product teams in making data-driven decisions*   Research the healthcare and healthcare staffing marketplace to make recommendations for the product roadmap based on market opportunities*  Your qualifications:: * Experience working with SQL to extract and join multiple datasets to create insights*   Experience working within a software Product team to enable data-driven decision making to prioritize a product roadmap*   Strong verbal and written communication skills* *   Education* *  3–5 years experience generating insights from complex data sources* *   Preferred* * *  Previous experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud*   Adobe Analytics*  In return, we offer:: * Competitive pay*   Flexible work schedules - including work from home options available*   401 (k) retirement plan*   Healthcare coverage with corporate wellness program*   Free health center and health coaching for employees and dependents*   18 days of PTO your first year and paid holidays*   Up to 16 hours of paid volunteer time off*   Award-winning training and development programs* *   Click here to learn more about our company and culture.* * * *   #Associate*  How to Get Started: * *   To have your resume reviewed by Talent Acquisition, click “Apply” at the top of the screen.* * *  * * *  We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer* * *   Veterans/Disabled* * *   We are an at-will employer* *

Title: Data Analyst
Description: The Role and the Team*The Workflow team is a core business support function, who are responsible for the data interactions between our business and our clients. Across the team, this includes managing client relationships and vendors, supporting business systems used by internal users, the data, reporting, and ETL process, and large volume data and document exchange during our legal outsourcing processes.*Responsibilities for this role include: *Cleansing, importing and exporting of large and sensitive datasets using a dynamic SQL based process;* Managing all outgoing and incoming data relating to our external legal network;* Managing daily processes relating to data exchange and maintenance, including SFTP file retrieval and upload;* Developing new and ad hoc reporting for Clients and internal stakeholders using SSRS Report Builder;* Receiving and analysing feedback from users to improve systems, processes and reporting;* Enhancing and maintaining data management processes that support Workflow processes.*Skills and key requirements: *Intermediate SQL skills;* SAS, SSRS, PowerShell, or Python skills desired, but not essential;* Ability to thoroughly document business processes;* Exceptional attention to detail;* Able to work in a fast paced changing environment.*Working in a fairly flat management structure, you will get the opportunity to work with senior stakeholders and make an impact with the work you will be doing. If you’re looking for an opportunity to work for a Financial Services organisation which offers growth and development and has a great culture, then this is the role for you!*Even though technical skills are important in this role, we value an individual with the right attitude and behaviours who is happy to take on any challenge and open to feedback and coaching.*Job Type: Full-time*Salary: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year*Benefits:*Dental insurance* Health insurance* Paid time off*Schedule:*8 hour shift*Supplemental pay types:*Bonus pay*Work Location: One location

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description: * ASSOCIATE DATA SCIENTIST* *  YOUR OPPORTUNITY *  You could be our next Associate Data Scientist! We are looking for a top-notch solution designer to support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. If you are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action, you have come to the right place. *  You have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. You have a proven ability to drive business results with your data-based insights and are comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. You are passionate about discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.* *  WHO WE ARE *  At InMoment, we have a saying: #OwnTheMomentsThatMatter. And we live it! As a team, we recognize that every moment offers a new opportunity to make an impact and leave our mark. We take deliberate action to make the lives of our families, teammates, clients, and community better within every interaction. *  We are dedicated to our game-changing mission of Experience Improvement (XI), helping our clients improve experiences at the intersection of value—where customer, employee, and business needs come together. We consistently challenge the status quo in the customer experience (CX), employee experience (EX), market research (MX), and product experience (PX) industries with our hyper-modern technology platform, decades of domain authority, and global teams of experts. And we have more innovation in store! *  Are you ready to #OwnTheMomentsThatMatter with us?* *  WHO YOU ARE * 1-3 + years of experience with Tableau or similar BI tools. *  Proven experience delivering Business Intelligence solutions. *  Experience with Tableau, Dashboard design and delivery *  Strong understanding of SQL *  Understanding of Programming languages like Python and R *  Excellent problem solving, design, debugging, and testing skills *  Ability to work with multiple different personality types while managing workload within a fast paced, energetic and dynamic workplace. *  Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. *  Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage etc.) and experience with applications. *  Experience working with and creating data architectures *  Experience using design, development, testing and deployment of Tableau Dashboards*  * WHAT YOU’LL DO * Build Tableau-based solutions with advanced tableau functions (parameters, actions, tooltip, modification, API, etc.) to create analytical dashboards with end user functionality in mind. *  Work with a diverse group of stakeholders and team members performing high level and detailed analysis, defining and writing programs using Tableau and leveraging the API. *  Perform system integration and deployment activities. *  Prepare support documentation and document program and system functions. *  Structure ambiguous business problems and recommend visualization solutions. *  Develop a strong understanding of business requirements; working with business users / business analysts to define technical and process requirements.*  *  WHAT YOU’LL GAIN * Autonomy - We trust our employees and offer an extremely flexible work schedule *  Unlimited PTO - We encourage all employees to recharge! *  Medical with HSA (which includes generous employer match & contribution) and FSA options *  Dental and vision insurance *  401(k) with a generous company match, access to a personal financial planner, and both legal and life insurance *  Generous Parental leave program *  Legal, ID theft, and employer-paid disability and life insurance *  Access to wellbeing initiatives and offerings such as our Employee Assistance Program *  Fun, innovative, collaborative, supportive working environment *  Inclusion and Diversity teams - Women of InMoment and InMovement *  Employee rewards and referral programs with generous payouts *  An opportunity to truly ‘Leave your Mark’ in a global organization. Come join our team!*  *  KEY RELATIONSHIPS *  Reports to Team Lead, Solution Design* *  At InMoment, inclusion and diversity are at the core of who we are. InMoment prides itself on an inclusive culture that promotes, encourages, and supports the diverse voices of our employees and clients. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the communities we serve and believe that different perspectives, interests, and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment.**

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Description: * About this role:*  Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Analytics Consultant in Consumer and Small Business Banking. Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at www.wellsfargo.com . *  This Consultant will identify and implement a data-driven, consistent process of surveillance and supervision for branch activities, with a particular emphasis on sales practices and operational risk. * In this role, you will:*  Identify and implement a data-driven, consistent process of surveillance and supervision for branch activities, with a particular emphasis on sales practices and operational risk *  Identify and implement a data-driven, consistent process of surveillance and supervision for branch activities, with a particular emphasis on sales practices and operational risk *  Review and research moderately complex business, operational, and technical challenges that require an in-depth evaluation of variable factors*   Perform complex financial and economic analysis and model development*   Plan, coordinate, and execute primary and secondary customer market projects*   Leverage advanced data analytics and machine learning techniques, as needed, to identify risk patterns and trends and provide insights on the effectiveness of Branch Supervision programs and processes. *  Leverage both structured and unstructured data and 'Big Data' analytic tools and platforms to provide insight into risk trends and help improve risk and monitoring processes. *  Leverage data and analytics to inform and influence line of business strategic planning team in long term plan development around sales supervision. *  Partner closely with other Risk Management teams to support Branch Quality Reviews, Compliance Reviews and other activities providing data analytics as required. *  Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, external contractors, and managers to resolve issues and achieve goals*   Responsible for all aspects of rolling out detection and monitoring strategies across Branch banking and Small Business, including but not limited to project management, requirements gathering, development, testing and implementation, documentation and adherence to all governance routines *  Collaborate with the front line business and control teams provide monitoring and surveillance solutions in response to Issue Management needs on highly visible Corrective Actions with enterprise impacts. *  Partner closely with leaders to identify and optimize the ongoing risk analysis and reporting necessary to support front line accountability for sales practices and other key risk issues. *  Collaborate with senior leaders and/or peers to develop robust actionable metrics and reporting to monitor sales practice and/or other field risk. * Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants* Required Qualifications:*  4+ years of Analytics experience or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education*   3+ years of SAS/SQL programming experience including; gathering, analyzing and interpreting large datasets from multiple sources through work experience or education*  Desired Qualifications:*  Experience successfully developing actionable data analytics and data strategies to inform, influence, and drive business outcomes *  Articulate and possess strong data analytic experience and have strong interpersonal effectiveness with the ability to translate complex analytics in to easily understood insights and summarizing or presenting to various levels of management.*   Knowledge and understanding of business intelligence tools*   Experience providing credible challenge to business partners when necessary, with the ability to lead through influence in a matrix environment*   Experience leading a fast paced, demanding, and deadline driven environment*   Ability to articulate issues, risks, and proposed solutions to various levels of staff and management*   Experience creating and presenting effective, informative and influential presentations to multiple levels of leaders and business partners*   Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills*   Extensive experience with research and analysis*   Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy*  Job Expectations: * Ability to travel up 5% of the time*  Posting Locations: * 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC*   11601 N Black Canyon Hwy - Phoenix, AZ*   2700 S Price Road - Chandler - AZ*   18190 N Dallas Pkwy - Dallas, TX*   800 S Jordan Creek Pkwy - West Des Moines, IA*   400 Highway 169 S - Minneapolis, MN*   4101 Wiseman Blvd Bldg 108 - San Antonio, TX*   114 N Beaumont St - D Bldg - Saint Louis, MO*   5201 W Amelia Earhart Dr - Salt Lake City, UT * Required locations listed above. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.* We Value Diversity *  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law. *  Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. *  Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. *  Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.*
