Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Description: * At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.*  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.* About this role:*  Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Analytics Consultant in Commercial Banking as part of the Wholesale Customer Due Diligence group. Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com .* In this role, you will:*  Deliver higher quality product(s) and experience(s) to our customers more frequently*   Responsible for developing, evolving, and communicating the product vision, values, and priorities*   Identify and build relationships with key partners and stakeholders, communicating product vision, priorities, and release plans while soliciting and incorporating feedback*   Act as a conduit between the stakeholders, users, and teams by promoting frequent collaboration between them*   Support competitive market and trend analysis assessments to incorporate and prioritize key findings into product backlogs*   Monitor product area goals, KPIs/OKRs, and other performance indicators while managing risk and ensuring regulatory and policy compliance*   Coordinating with other product owners and product managers in service of the customer experience*   Identifying and managing dependencies and interdependencies*   Inspiring and leads a cross-functional team (e.g., technology, design, risk)*   Actively own and continuously maintain a prioritized product backlog aligned to product vision and goals*   Define and refine user stories, ensuring acceptance criteria is clearly understood by the team. Accountable for accepting user stories after they have been fully delivered and meet the definition of done*   Actively participate in all sprint planning, sprint review, and backlog refinement events*   Available to the team to answer questions and address escalated impediments*   Demonstrate continuous growth in understanding customer, user, and company needs related to the product*  Required Qualifications:*  4+ years of Analytics experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education*  Desired Qualifications:*  Experience with Jira*   Practical application working in a Scaled Agile multi-team environment*   Working knowledge of SaFE, LeSS, Scrum, Kanban*   Intermediate to advanced experience working with Jira, Confluence, SharePoint*   Ability to script simple queries using SQL for data research, ad-hoc reporting*   Advanced with presenting data to tell a meaningful story that translates to diverse audience segments with varying levels of senior leadership within the Financial crimes organization*   Experience working in a banking environment or highly regulated industries*   Basic understanding of Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Know your Customer (KYC), and Anti-money laundering (AML)*   Strong presentation and delivery skills with advanced knowledge using applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.*  Job Expectations:*  Ability to work outside of regular business hours as needed*  Posting Locations:*  550 S Tryon St, Charlotte, NC*   1445 Ross Ave, Dallas, TX*   801 Walnut St, Des Moines, IA*   600 S 4th St, Minneapolis, MN*   299 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT*   1150 W Washington St, Tempe, AZ*  #CommercialBanking * We Value Diversity *  At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; Title: Data Scientist II - Enterprise Research & Analytics
Description: Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home. *At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts. * What does a Data Scientist II do at Swire Coca-Cola? * As Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting world-class data science and advanced analytics inclusive of modeling and AI/ML techniques across all channels, customer and consumer segments, markets, and products/categories. This role drives business value via actionable analytics in conjunction with the rest of the ERA team. *Key Responsibilities:*Pursues (individually or in small teams) use cases across our business that will drive revenue, lower costs, increase our speed, and reduce our risk * Deploys predictive models, algorithms, clustering and other segmentation methods, and expertise exploring and manipulating data to provide elegant, usable, and measurable solutions our business partners can use to drive value * Proactively imagines and designs new tools and solutions for our business, from ideation to proof-of-concept approaches * Understands and can communicate the implications of findings to the business * Provides a transparent view into their work, documents and supports risks and monitoring of our intelligence (bias, testing standards, governance) *Qualifications:*Advanced degree in STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) or related field required * 8 years' experience using tools like Python and SQL to drive real-world outcomes using analytics, statistics and/or computer science experience * World class predictive analytics skillset: modeling, AI/ML, data cleansing and feature design * Understands and effectively utilizes analytics systems, databases, and tools * Experience working with cloud-native data and databases (such Snowflake, Azure, AWS, etc.) * Demonstrated ability to independently explore new data to discover opportunities and trends * Written and verbal communication skills * Strong customer service orientation * Up to 25% travel with overnight stays * Swire Coca-Cola, USA is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Business Data Information Analyst - Salt Lake City (hybrid)
Description: * Zions Bancorporation has just opened an opportunity for an experienced Business Data Information Analyst within the Enterprise Data & Analytics "ED&A" department located at our new Zions Technology Center in Midvale, Utah. If you are ready to move your career forward, read on.*  * Zions Bancorporation is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet ever-changing demands. Your ability to adapt, learn innovate and collaborate with a dynamic team helps us provide exceptional service to our customers and communities.*  * Zions Bancorporation is committed to helping our employees grow, develop and advance in their career. Our Workforce of the Future, DEI and UpSkilling initiatives allow you to network across the organization, volunteer in our community, and build your technical and soft skills. We believe that investing in your success and well-being is an investment in our customers and our business.* * Together we are building a culture that values diversity, celebrates growth and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. Our people are what set us apart and make us great.*  * The Business Data Information Analyst will help us acquire data from operational systems and position it to support operational or managerial and analytical reporting. This candidate is expected to become a SME in banking information in partnership with the Operational Analysts and our team.*  * What will your day look like? You will: * Work within a SAFe Agile team to build and maintain a Continuous Delivery Pipeline that delivers new functionality to users *  Analyze, and map system data into the operational or integrated data warehouse or big data platform to meet reporting and analytical business needs *  Test and validate data attributes based both on source data and results from other systems to ensure the data accurately reflects the source system and business needs *  Work with source system Operational Analysts to understand system nuances and resolve issues *  Work with reporting teams to explain the data to report writers and communicate the scope and impact of changes *  Take ownership of the SDLC process and manage work quality and quantity through frequent releases, closely coordinating with data engineers, modelers, product owners, and other information analysts *  Create and maintain clear, detailed, and accurate metadata documentation *  Lead small projects and teams to develop solutions for our customers working with the modeling and architecture team and business analysts across multiple departments *  Handle other duties as assigned*  * Who should apply? * We want someone who has: * Well-honed knowledge of the banking industry, loan and deposit systems, regulatory reporting requirements, or data warehouse, data lake, common data model experience *  Skilled with programming and scripting languages (SQL, Python, GCP) *  Strong testing skills (GIT) *  Experience with Google Cloud Platform *  Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills *  Experience using SDLC process *  Ability to estimate scope and schedule required and commit to deadlines *  Effective presentation and communication skills interpersonal skills *  Ability to work with management, peers, and technical staff *  Bachelor's degree plus related experience may meet requirements, MBA a plus *  2+ years' experience in business analysis, operations support, software development, project management, or other directly related experience * A combination of education and experience may meet requirements.*  * Location: This opportunity will be in our brand-new Zions Technology Center in Midvale, Utah. We have a hybrid schedule of 3 days in the office and 2 days within the Salt Lake City area. * The Zions Technology Center is a 400,000-square-foot technology campus in Midvale, Utah. Located on the former Sharon Steel Mill superfund site, the sustainably built campus is the company’s primary technology and operations center. This modern and environmentally friendly technology center will enable Zions to continue to compete for the best technology talent in the state while providing team members with an exceptional work environment with features such as: * Electric vehicle charging stations and close proximity to Historic Gardner Village UTA TRAX station *  At least 75% of the building is powered by on-site renewable solar energy *  Access to outdoor recreation, parks, trails, shareable bikes and locker rooms *  Large modern cafe with a healthy and diverse menu *  Healthy indoor environment with ample natural light and fresh air *  LEED-certified sustainable building* * Apply now if you have a passion for impactful outcomes, enjoy working collaboratively with co-workers, and want to make a difference for the clients and communities we serve.*

Title: Sr. Analyst (Customer Experience), Data Science & Modeling
Description: Merrick Bank employees share in our mission to delight our customers and empower underserved consumers to achieve their credit goals. In return, we delight our associates; ensuring they are noticed, heard, appreciated and understand the importance of their role(s). For over 20 years, our Guiding Principles of; doing the right thing, putting the customer first, and Earn, Learn, Have Fun (aka E.L.F.), have defined who we are as an Employer of Choice. Give Yourself Credit, Work at Merrick! * The Customer Experience Sr. Analyst supports the strategic design of customer experience programs for the Credit Card Business and reports directly to the Senior Vice President and General Manager of the Credit Card Business, yielding high visibility to executives and business leaders across the organization. In general, the duties of the customer experience analyst will include analyzing data, summarizing and creating reports for the management team, and coordinating efforts to improve, enhance and optimize the credit card customer experience at Merrick Bank. *Essential Functions:*Collaborates with cross-functional teams to deliver and support end-to-end customer experience goals, programs, and practices across the organization * Consolidates customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers * Supports the strategic design, implementation and optimization of customer experience programs and initiatives that ensure a best-in-class customer experience * Researches best practices to develop metrics and methods to collect and analyze customer data and feedback * Utilizes data management tools to establish a continuous stream of data to analyze, measure, and evaluate customer behaviors and opinions *Compliance with Laws & Regulations:*Responsible for complying with all of the Bank’s internal control policies and procedures. * Responsible for understanding and complying with all laws and regulations to which the Bank is subject. * Responsible for communicating problems in operations, noncompliance with the code of conduct, noncompliance with laws and regulations, policy violations, or illegal acts. *Education and Experience:*Bachelors’ Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer/Data Science, or a related field of study is required, four (4) years’ experience accepted in lieu of education requirement. * Five (5) years’ relevant, customer service related work experience in the financial services industry is required. *Summary of Qualifications:*Excellent administrative, organizational and business support skills * Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly formal report writing * Team oriented * Candidate is preferred to have strong analytical skills * Must be a self-starter, flexible, innovative, adaptive and organized * Must be able to work both collaboratively and independently, with a limited level of direct supervision * Ability to see the big picture with excellent attention to critical details and possesses follow-up skills * Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills * Proficient in MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) * Who is Merrick Bank? Founded over 20 years ago, Merrick Bank is a FDIC-insured Utah Industrial Loan Bank that originates loans with the benefit of low-cost deposit funding. Merrick Bank had $4.5 billion in assets and $3.1 billion in deposits as of March 31, 2021. Merrick Bank operates four main business lines: Credit Cards, Recreation Lending, Personal Loans and Merchant Acquiring. * Our Valued Employees are provided generous benefits, including: *Competitive Pay * Benefits Package -Medical, Dental and Vision (plus much more) * 401(k) Plan with Company Match * Short & Long Term Disability * Group Life and AD&D Insurance * Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days * Employee Events, including Employee Appreciation Day, Holiday Party, etc. * Tuition Reimbursement Program * Candidates must have unrestricted authority to work in the United States without sponsorship. * Merrick Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristic. *Merrick Bank will do a thorough background check for all hires. Give Yourself Credit, Work at Merrick! * This position provides business control and monitoring activities in support of all Lending Business lines and reports directly to the General Manager of the Credit Card Business. This framework includes, but is not limited to, the ongoing development and implementation of a business control framework, the execution and monitoring of existing controls, development of new controls, and the management of any issue and remediation efforts of identified inadequacies *Essential Functions:*Builds strong working relationships with management and staff across all functions to achieve business control objectives * Collaborates with key stakeholders across the Lending Business, Legal, Compliance, Operations & Technology * Executes key business control activities to ensure violations, or illegal acts. *Education and Experience:*Bachelor’s degree is required, four years’ experience accepted in lieu of education requirement. * Master's degree in a relevant quantitative industry is required. *Summary of Qualifications:*Excellent administrative, organizational and business support skills * Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly formal report Title: Material Requirement Planning Analyst (Roy, UT or Huntsville...
Description: * Requisition ID: R10056527 * Category: Global Supply Chain *  Location: Roy, Utah, United States of America *  Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship *  Clearance Type: Secret *  Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position *  Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) *  Travel Required: No *  Positions Available: 2* *  At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.*   Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking an experienced Material Requirements Planning Analyst for our Roy, UT or Huntsville, AL locations.*  *   This position will be fully engaged with the GSC team and other functions to develop, implement, and operate an integrated Material Requirements Planning (MRP) system within the Division. As part of the Global Supply Chain function our team enjoys a fast-paced work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, and collaboration across all levels.*  *   The SDS Principal Supply Chain Operations Specialist will report to the Strategic Deterrent Systems (SDS) Manager of Supply Chain Operations and MRP for the Strategic Deterrent Systems Division in Northrop Grumman's Space Sector. This individual will contribute to a team that is responsible for the standup of all SDS Division Global Supply Chain processes that are documented through Principle Operating Procedures. The selected candidate will Ooversees and manages the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serves as liaison between GSC, project program management and other funcations within the broader Division organizationplanning, project team, and line management. Reviews status of projects and budgets; manages schedules and prepares status reports.*  *   Duties Responsibilities will include:*   Enter material requirement requisitions in the ERP system signaling procurement activities and track deliveries to ensure support of production schedules*    Extract and analyze data for decision making using existing reporting tools*    Coordinate with other departments as required to ensure material availability*    Team player with strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills*    Communicate relevant information both up and down the functional organization*    Highly organized, detail oriented and self-motivated with demonstrated abilities to prioritize work and meet tight deadlines*    Demonstrated ability to think analytically, solve problems and convert complex data to actionable information*    Make recommendation for and work with developers on new reports to support MRP implementation and maintenance*    Detail oriented, but able to understand the big picture*    Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office, especially Excel*    Develop collaborative relationships with functional stakeholders to achieve scheduling culture change*    Work on special projects, as necessary*  *   Basic Qualifications*   A Bachelor's degree or higher in Business, Supply Chain, or related field and 3+ years of relevant experience in Supply Chain, Operations, and/or Production Management. Or, in lieu of a degree, 7+ years of relevant experience in Supply Chain, Operations, and/or Production Management.*    Experience with operation of ERP and MRP systems in aerospace manufacturing and/or supply chain*    Must be motivated, organized and have effective time management skills*    Must be able to effectively work independently with very general supervision*    Proficiency using MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)*    Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance*  *   Preferred Qualifications*   Prior work experience in Aerospace & Defense*    Experience with FAR/DFARS*    Prior work experience with MRP in SAP*    ASCM Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM)*    Active DoD Secret Clearance*  * *  Salary Range: $53,500 USD - $80,300 USD* * *  Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.*  * *  The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/.*  *   Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.* **

Title: Risk Adjustment Analyst, Health Plans
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84112 (East Bench area)
Description: * Overview * As a patient-focused organization, University of Utah Health exists to enhance the health and well-being of people through patient care, research and education. Success in this mission requires a culture of collaboration, excellence, leadership, and respect. University of Utah Health seeks staff that are committed to the values of compassion, collaboration, innovation, responsibility, diversity, integrity, quality and trust that are integral to our mission. EO/AA * The Risk Adjustment Data Analyst, a member of the Risk Adjustment team, provides support by leveraging multiple data domains to answer important business questions. This position is connected with multiple teams to ensure that data are reviewed, explained and reported to measure success for Risk Adjustment Enablement projects. This position will have a primary focus on supporting Risk Adjustment compliance and audit projects. * This position is primarily remote, with occasional in-office needs. Preference to candidates within the state of UT. * Corporate Overview: University of Utah Health Hospitals and Clinics is an integrated academic healthcare system with five hospitals including a level 1 trauma center, eleven community health centers, over 1,600 providers, and a health plan serving over 200,000 members. University of Utah Health Hospitals and Clinics is nationally ranked and recognized for our academic research, quality standards and overall patient experience. In addition to our clinical delivery system, we have a School of Medicine, School of Dentistry, College of Nursing, College of Pharmacy, and College of Health providing education and training for over 1,250 providers annually. We have over 2 million patient visits annually and research grants exceeding $350 million. * Responsibilities * Assists in the analysis and reporting solutions which address risk adjustment compliance and audit business needs. *  Identifies and analyzes user requirements, procedures and prepares detailed specifications from which analysis and reports will be written. *  Analyzes and revises existing reporting logic difficulties and documentation as necessary. *  Works on most phases of the team risk adjustment analysis project activities. *  Leverages data and predictive analysis to clearly articulate problems and influence decisions that support the strategic direction. *  Communicates key information to Compliance and Audit partners for awareness of trends, processes and risk adjustment issues. *  Works closely with Compliance, Audit and other data domain leaders that share risk adjustment responsibilities. *  Reviews, researches, investigates and corrects issues through data and process analysis. *  Develops collaborative relationships with internal partners to ensure risk adjustment goals are met. *  Analyzes the integrity of data, diagnose issues and test changes. *  Participates in change management procedures to support accurate risk adjustment team documentation and process flows supporting processes and requirements. *  Maintains reporting describing results against internal goals; presenting results and updates to leadership. *  Resolves issues and problems by conferring with both internal and external partners as necessary. *  Maintains professional contact with other departments as needed; attend interdepartmental meetings. * Knowledge / Skills / Abilities * Ability to perform complex research and analysis of healthcare claims, enrollment, and other related data, to report on network utilization, cost structure, and/or quality. *  Ability to build, perform, and maintain risk adjustment models and analyses for tracking and reporting at the department, senior leadership, and provider level. *  Demonstrated knowledge with the specific risk adjustment models. HHS HCC, CMS HCC an MARA. *  Demonstrated knowledge of SAS. *  Demonstrated knowledge of SSIS/SSRS, Tableau, Crystal or equivalent reporting applications. *  Excellent oral and written communication skills. *  Ability to achieve results independently and with a team. *  Strong analytical and creative problem solving skills. *  Experience doing root cause analysis and reporting. *  Demonstrated knowledge with various types and sources of healthcare information; including claim, provider and patient-level data. * Qualifications * Qualifications Required * Bachelor's Degree required, strong preference in Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field. *  At least 1 year experience in performing risk adjustment analysis. *  Strong SQL experience. *  Understanding of basic Healthcare Terminology. * Qualifications (Preferred) * Preferred * Medicare Data experience. * Working Conditions and Physical Demands * Employee must be able to meet the following requirements with or without an accommodation. * This is a sedentary position in an office setting that may exert up to 10 pounds and may lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects. This position involves sitting most of the time and is not exposed to adverse environmental conditions. * Physical Requirements * Carrying, Color Determination, Far Vision, Listening, Manual Dexterity, Near Vision, Sitting, Speaking, Standing, Walking * EEO Statement * University of Utah Health Hospitals and Clinics, a part of The University of Utah, values candidates who have experience working in settings with students from diverse backgrounds and possess a strong commitment to improving access to higher education for historically underrepresented students. * Individuals from historically underrepresented groups, such as minorities, women, qualified persons with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Veterans’ preference is extended to qualified applicants, upon request and consistent with University policy and Utah state law. Upon request, reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to individuals with disabilities. * University of Utah Heath Hospitals and Clinics, a part of The University of Utah, is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information, or protected veteran's status. The University does not discriminate on the basis of sex in the education program or activity that it operates, as required by Title IX and 34 CFR part 106. The requirement not to discriminate in education programs or activities extends to admission and employment. Inquiries about the application of Title IX and its regulations may be referred to the Title IX Coordinator, to the Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, or both. * To request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, please contact the University of Utah Health Hospitals and Clinics Human Resources office at 801-581-6500.If you or someone you know has experienced discrimination or sexual misconduct including sexual harassment, you may contact the Director/Title IX Coordinator in the Office of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action: * Sherrie Hayashi * Director/ Title IX Coordinator * Office of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action (OEO/AA) * 135 Park Building * Salt Lake City, UT 84112 * 801-581-8365 * oeo@utah.edu * Online reports may be submitted atoeo.utah.edu/ * For more information: https://www.utah.edu/nondiscrimination/ * To inquire about this posting, email: careers@hsc.utah.edu * The University is a participating employer with Utah Retirement Systems (“URS”). Eligible new hires with prior URS service, may elect to enroll in URS if they make the election before they become eligible for retirement (usually the first day of work). Contact Hospitals and Clinics Human Resources at (801) 581-6500 for information. Individuals who previously retired and are receiving monthly retirement benefits from URS are subject to URS’ post-retirement rules and restrictions. Please contact Utah Retirement Systems at (801) 366-7770 or (800) 695-4877 or Hospitals and Clinics Human Resources at (801) 581-6500 if you have questions regarding the post-retirement rules. * This position may require the successful completion of a criminal background check and/or drug screen. * Requisition Number 54642 * Reg/Temp Regular * Employment Type Full-Time * Shift Day * Work Schedule M-F 8-5 * Location Name University of Utah Health Plans * Patient Care? No * City Murray * State UT * Department UIP CST 01H Quality Improvemnt * Category Insurance / Health Plans**

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst for German Language
Description: Job Title: Entry Level Data Analyst for German Language*Hiring language auditors for the following languages: *German*Volga Partners is currently hiring for candidates for Data Analyst role! *Rate: $15.00/hour [If applicable, Volga Partners follows all state and city's minimum wage requirements in respective city and/or state of applicant.]*Job Brief: *Data analyst play a vital role in researching information for various entities, tools, and data provided during the on-job training. Candidate should possess good logical and analytical skills to judge the data and give the reasoning.* Interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to improve a business* Take batches of data, to label and manipulate according to the project requirements with sufficient level of accuracy* Own the quality of all training data and work on proactively identifying issues* Work closely with Data Science and Product team on multiple projects to present data quality metrics & identifying new attributes*Responsibilities and Duties: *Flexibility to respond and react to changing priorities quickly and efficiently highly organized with attention to detail and a commitment to quality Being able to track and analyze.*Regularly working on different kinds of tools which include UHRS.*Focusing on the task at hand and most importantly should have sharp cognitive skills.*Key Skills: *Good oral and written communication language skills and cultural awareness of the target locale ability to understand and prioritize tasks. The ideal person should also be fluent in spoken English and also understand how people talk commonly in the workplace, at home and in the street and also have good writing skills.*Required Experience and Qualifications: *EXPERTISE (Reading, writing and/or speaking) in both English and respective German language.*Associate degree/ certification in IT/ Communication/Research in similar fields (Preferred, but not required.)*Excellent computer skills, especially typing and written.*Attention to detail.*Multilingual may be preferred or required.*Desire to be proactive and create a positive experience for others.*Work Authorization: Must have valid work authorization to work in United States. *Background Check: Background checks are mandatory for this position.*Currently hiring candidates in the following states: AZ - Arizona, CA - California, FL - Florida, HI - Hawaii, IL - Illinois, MA - Massachusetts, MI - Michigan, MN - Minnesota, NJ - New Jersey, NY - New York, NV - Nevada, OH - Ohio, OR - Oregon, PA - Pennsylvania, TX - Texas, UT - Utah, VA - Virginia, WA - Washington*Please read requirement thoroughly before applying: *Must have own device (laptop/device).* Must be flexible with training hours for the first few weeks.* Must be available to work between 10am -2pm Pacific Standard Time [Monday - Friday]* Experience with UHRS platform is a plus!*Job Types: Part-time, Contract*Pay: $15.00 - $17.00 per hour*Benefits:*401(k)* 401(k) matching* Paid time off*Schedule:*4 hour shift* Day shift* Monday to Friday*Application Question(s):*Can you write and read in German ?*Experience:*Data analysis skills: 1 year (Preferred)*Language:*German (Required)*Work Location: Multiple Locations

Title: Jr. Machine Learning Engineer
Description: * *  WE ARE* * * *   We are Black Rifle Coffee Company, a veteran-owned company serving premium coffee to people who love America. We have a passion for coffee, the veteran community, dogs, the outdoors... in short, if it makes our country awesome, then we love it. Our customers always come first, because without them we would have nothing. They have our eternal gratitude for that. We sell awesome coffee and make goofy videos, but the beating heart of Black Rifle Coffee is really in giving back — it's about serving those who serve us. That means supporting the military, veteran, and first responder communities in the ways we know best. As far as the folks who work here, we value integrity, innovation, radical transparency, a crazy good work ethic, and a deep love for our country and each other.* * * *   The Black Rifle Coffee is looking for a Jr. ML Engineer to help optimize implementation and delivery of Data Science and Analytics projects and applications. This position will be responsible for supporting the development of AI solutions to support BRCC’s growth initiatives across eCommerce, wholesale, and brick and mortar. You will help with the technical design, development and implementation of machine learning applications to help solve real-world business problems and have the opportunity to continuously learn and apply best practices in machine learning engineering.* *  Leadership & Functional Responsibilities * Work with business stakeholders, investigate areas for business growth and provide recommendations for AI/ML solutions*   Collaborate with data, engineering and product teams to rapidly prototype proof of concept AI/ML solutions, implement and iterate when necessary*   Assist in streamlining data processes through automation, code optimization, or other tooling*   Facilitate adoption and management of data solutions through concise documentation (data contracts, flowcharts, “one-pagers”, etc)*   Manage metrics and A/B testing results*  Education & Skill Requirements * You are motivated and ambitious, have deep technical and analytical experience, and look for opportunities to build AI solutions to problems that directly impact the bottom line*   2+ years of Python experience*   3+ years of SQL experience*   Experience working with large, unstructured datasets*   Comfort in fast-moving environments and early stage projects*   Familiarity with industry recognized ML frameworks and understanding of common ML algorithms*   US Military or Veteran a plus * *  This is a full-time position and may require long hours and may require weekend and nights work per events* * * *   While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, stand, sit; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard reach, stoop kneel to install computer equipment* * *   Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision requirements due to computer work* * *   Light to moderate lifting is required* * *   Ability to uphold the stress of traveling* * *   Regular, predictable attendance is required; including quarter-driven hours as business demands dictate.* * *   Moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phone, and printers, light traffic).* * *   Ability to work in a confined area.* * *   Ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.* * * *   YOUR BENEFITS* * Please note that only Full Time, W2 Employees are eligible for Black Rifle Coffee Benefits* *  Comprehensive medical, dental & vision package*  401k with company match *  Company-paid life insurance + supplemental options*  Short and Long-Term disability options/coverage*  Extensive EAP program with legal coverage*  Pro-deal discounts with corporate partners in outdoor equipment, clothing, etc.*  American values-based culture built on freedom, integrity, accountability, respect, love, and commitment to serve those who have served.* * *   BRCC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other protected characteristic required by applicable law. All selected candidates will be required to submit to a pre-employment background check.* *

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84101 (People's Freeway area)
Description: * Utah Transit Authority*  Job Summary Directs and develops initiatives to improve quality, financial viability, sustainability, and efficiency of services offered by UTAs business units and departments. Facilitates business unit planning by developing and maintaining strategic analytical and financial tools. Collaborates with other UTA departments to make recommendations on strategic variables such as definition of new markets, service standards, benchmarking, pricing/fare policies, and customer satisfaction. Develops and maintains effective monitoring and measurement methods to analyze the performance effectiveness of business units and identifies actionable areas for improvement. Reviews, analyzes and interprets financial data to drive operational budget performance. Assists in the creation of annual budgets, budget metrics, key performance indicators and strategic objectives. Organizes and teaches process improvement training. Coaches and mentors on improvement projects. Serves as an integral member of the business unit leadership team*  Minimum Qualifications*  EDUCATION/TRAINING*  Bachelor's Degree in Business, Operations Research, Finance, or a related/relevant field.*   Mastersdegree in a business related field is preferred.*  EXPERIENCE*  Four years previous analytical experience in operations performance.*   Must be able to initiate and perform highly technical analytical work without frequent supervision including collecting and interpreting data using statistical and other analytical tools and models.*   Will be required to perform technical work, individually or as the member of a project team.*   Occasionally, after hours and/or weekend work will be required.*  KNOWLEDGE:*  Knowledge and training in ISO, LEAN and Six-Sigma principles preferred.*  SKILLS:*  Must demonstrate strong critical and logical reasoning skills.*   Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.*   Microsoft Office proficiency at an intermediate level in Word and PowerPoint; at an advanced level in Excel; and at a standard level in Outlook.*   Experience with business intelligence tools (i.e. Power BI) preferred*   Experience with SQL preferred*  ABILITIES:*  Must show ability to understand, articulate and advocate for business recommendations and financial solutions.*  This job requires regular and predictable attendance* *   - *  OR -* * *   An equivalent combination or relevant education and experience.*   (UTA reserves the right to determine the equivalencies of education and experience.)* *  *  Pay Rate: Starting at $71,196.32 based upon experience*  PM21*  PI185584547*

This position will be responsible for supporting the development of AI solutions to support BRCC’s growth initiatives across eCommerce, wholesale, and brick and mortar. You will help with the technical design, development and implementation of machine learning applications to help solve real-world business problems and have the opportunity to continuously learn and apply best practices in machine learning engineering.* *  Leadership & Functional Responsibilities * Work with business stakeholders, investigate areas for business growth and provide recommendations for AI/ML solutions*   Collaborate with data, engineering and product teams to rapidly prototype proof of concept AI/ML solutions, implement and iterate when necessary*   Assist in streamlining data processes through automation, code optimization, or other tooling*   Facilitate adoption and management of data solutions through concise documentation (data contracts, flowcharts, “one-pagers”, etc)*   Manage metrics and A/B testing results*  Education & Skill Requirements * You are motivated and ambitious, have deep technical and analytical experience, and look for opportunities to build AI solutions to problems that directly impact the bottom line*   2+ years of Python experience3+ years of SQL experience*   Experience working with large, unstructured datasets*   Comfort in fast-moving environments and early stage projects*   Familiarity with industry recognized ML frameworks and understanding of common ML algorithms*   US Military or Veteran a plus * *  This is a full-time position and may require long hours and may require weekend and nights work per events* * * *   While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, stand, sit; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard reach, stoop kneel to install computer equipment* * *   Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision requirements due to computer work* * *   Light to moderate lifting is required* * *   Ability to uphold the stress of traveling* * *   Regular, predictable attendance is required; including quarter-driven hours as business demands dictate.* * *   Moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phone, and printers, light traffic).* * *   Ability to work in a confined area.* * *   Ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.* * * *   YOUR BENEFITS* * Please note that only Full Time, W2 Employees are eligible for Black Rifle Coffee Benefits* *  Comprehensive medical, dental & vision package*  401k with company match *  Company-paid life insurance + supplemental options*  Short and Long-Term disability options/coverage*  Extensive EAP program with legal coverage*  Pro-deal discounts with corporate partners in outdoor equipment, clothing, etc.*  American values-based culture built on freedom, integrity, accountability, respect, love, and commitment to serve those who have served.* * *   BRCC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other protected characteristic required by applicable law. All selected candidates will be required to submit to a pre-employment background check.* *

Title: Data Engineer
Description: At LeaseHawk, our passion is to drive superior results for owners and operators of apartment buildings through the creative use of technology. Our industry-leading virtual leasing assistant leverages artificial intelligence and powerful analytics to automate the leasing journey, allowing renters to search for their next home on their terms, while freeing the leasing staff to focus on delivering a world-class experience to their residents.*We are looking for a data engineer who loves working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with a talented team of engineers to build innovative solutions that delight renters and property managers alike!*Our office is located in beautiful Scottsdale, AZ. We have a flexible working arrangement that supports personal preferences to work in the office full-time, remote full-time, or a hybrid.*Job Duties:*Provide data engineering support to software developers building new features in LeaseHawk SaaS, business intelligence, and machine learning products.* Troubleshoot performance issues with transactional and reporting systems.* Build and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models.* Develop complex procedures and functions that query and update data in relational and NoSQL databases.*Education and Experience*Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science related field from an accredited college or university or equivalent work experience, or 5+ years of equivalent work experience*3 or more years of experience working with AWS big data technologies, AWS core services, and utilizing AWS architectural best practices*Preferred Qualifications*No visa sponsorship is available for this role.* Passion for data engineering and problem solving.* Effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.* Expert with relational database systems, particularly PostgreSQL* Expert with NoSQL databases, particularly Elasticsearch* Proficient with SQL, data modeling, data management, and ETL development* Demonstrated understanding of database design principles.* Demonstrated expertise working with data visualization tools, such as Power BI or Tableau* Demonstrated understanding of data lakes and data warehouses platforms.*Job Type: Full-time*Benefits:*401(k)* Dental insurance* Flexible schedule* Health insurance* Health savings account* Life insurance* Paid time off* Retirement plan* Vision insurance*Schedule:*8 hour shift*Experience:*Data Engineering: 5 years (Required)* SQL: 5 years (Required)* PostgreSQL: 1 year (Required)* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)* Elasticsearch: 1 year (Preferred)* ETL: 3 years (Preferred)*Work Location: Multiple Locations

Title: Junior Data Science Engineer
Description: * Description * * Job Description:*  The Defense Group at Leidos has an opening for a Junior Data Science Engineer for the Global Solutions Management – Operations II (GSM-O II) contract. This contract includes the Operations, Sustainment, Maintenance, Repair and Defense of the Defense Information System Network (DISN) within the DOD Information Network (DODIN) in support of the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). This role is primarily remote, but candidates must be within commuting distance to Scott AFB, IL or Ft. Meade, MD or Ogden, UT for on-site support.* *  Primary Responsibilities*  Solve stakeholder problems and improve business efficiency through direct quantitative and qualitative data analysis, followed by the design, implementation, and documentation of the solutions as repeatable processes.*   Obtain and integrate data sets from disparate technical environments to support network, performance, application and configuration use cases, performing extraction, transform, and load (ETL) tasks and developing ETL pipelines.*   Develop, test, and maintain data models (both physical and logical), including identifying the data’s relevant metadata to ensure consistency, quality, accuracy, integrity, information assurance, and security.*   Leverage AI/ML techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, to increase efficiencies by creating and optimizing data pipelines that support predictive analytics, classification, anomaly detection, and decision tree use cases.*   Develop, train and deploy AI/ML models using resources and tools in an AWS containerized environment.*   Configure and prototype ML solutions in Jupyter notebooks.*   Work collaboratively with a cross-functional, geographically dispersed team and partner closely with Network Operations stakeholders to develop data analytics automation techniques to improve results and efficiency.* *  Basic Qualifications*  B.S. degree in Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Data Science, or Data Analytics and 1+ year of related experience obtained through any combination of coursework and internships.*   Educational experience or courses/projects in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Statistics.*   Practical experience with Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and/or Artificial Intelligence and the ability to apply these techniques concrete problems.*   Practical hands-on data experience, including the ability to hypothesize, test and explain statistical analysis techniques that can be applied to the data to provide business value.*   Strong communication skills that will enable proactive and effective collaboration with a virtual team of data engineers and DevOps engineers, including the ability to articulate data requirements and translate requirements from stakeholders for AI/ML project needs.*   Experience in R, Java, Python, Scala, SAS, SPSS or similar.*   Experience following a software development lifecycle, including developing and maintaining production quality code.*   Ability to obtain interim Secret DoD Security clearance prior to start date.*   Ability to obtain Security+ certification or equivalent DoD 8570 IAT II certification within 60 days of start date.* *  Preferred Qualifications*  Experience developing data analysis prototypes.*   Practical experience applying data analytics to business problems.*   Experience automating data cleansing, formatting, staging, and transformation.*   Experience with text mining tools and techniques, including in areas of summarization, search (e.g., ELK Stack), entity extraction, training set generation, and anomaly detection.*   Familiarity with CI/CD techniques to develop and release software using containerized pipelines.*   Experience with Big Data tools including Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana, Apache Kafka, NiFi, Apache Spark, Neo4J, Predictive Insights, and Splunk.*   Experience with Deep Learning Frameworks.*   Experience with interpretability of deep learning models.*   Python experience with ML libraries, such as SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, and Keras on both CPU and GPU compute architectures.* *  Pay Range: Pay Range $50,700.00 - $78,000.00 - $105,300.00* *  The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.*  #Remote*

You are a thought partner who has a strong desire and determination to succeed. The Sr. Business Analyst must have a robust background in accounting/finance to address operational and financial risk associated with Managed Service Providers.* *  You Will:*  Liaison with Managed Service Partner on account; address issues to reconciliation*   Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive) by recognizing improvement opportunities*   Contribute to the definition, monitoring and communication of success metrics by project. Monthly/quarterly closes along with ad-hoc reporting*   Prepare cash flow reporting for managers and gather variances analysis for consolidated reporting to finance partners*   Facilitate capitalization of projects with fixed assets team*   Gather information and prep documents for LTP, AOP and ACP* *  You Have:*  5+ years of experience as an Analyst with 2+ years demonstrated experience in finance or business processes*   Accustomed to managing large-scale, highly matrixed projects*   Examine information or a situation in detail to identify important elements, their strengths and weaknesses and use these to compile a convincing argument, make recommendations to solve a problem*   Convey data and analysis to our customers; able to extract and explain the "story" from the data* *  Preferred Qualifications:*  Advanced experience with Excel (can perform complex functions) , PowerPoint, and Visio*   Familiarity with the features (physical attributes), functions (useful for), and transaction processes in SAP*   Experience collaborating with a range of partners while understanding multiple perspectives*   Develop presentations, communications and training documents*   Demonstrated leadership qualities* *  Required Education:*  Bachelor's Degree from a 4-year college; professional certification desired but not required (ITIL, PMO and/or IIBA) or equivalent work experience* *  Preferred Education:*  Graduate degree in Accounting, Business, Finance or related field (MBA, MSA, etc.)* *  Flex Type Hybrid* *  #DPEPFLA**

Title: ERA - Data Scientist I
Description: Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home. *At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts. * What does a Data Scientist do at Swire Coca-Cola? * As Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting world-class data science and advanced analytics inclusive of modeling and AI/ML techniques across all channels, customer and consumer segments, markets, and products/categories. This role drives business value via actionable analytics in conjunction with the rest of the ERA team. *Key Responsibilities:*Pursues (individually or in small teams) use cases across our business that will drive revenue, lower costs, increase our speed, and reduce our risk * Assists in building predictive models, algorithms, clustering and other measurable solutions our business partners can use to drive value * Understands and can communicate the implications of findings to the business * Provides a transparent view into their work, documents and supports risks and monitoring of our intelligence (bias, testing standards, governance) *Qualifications:*Advanced degree in STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) or related field required * 4 years experience using tools like Python and SQL to drive real-world outcomes using analytics, statistics and/or computer science experience * Experience building and delivering predictive analytics: statistical methods, AI/ML, data cleansing * Understands and effectively utilizes analytics systems, databases, and tools * Demonstrated ability to independently explore new data to discover opportunities and trends * Written and verbal communication skills * Strong customer service orientation * Up to 25% travel with overnight stays * Swire Coca-Cola, USA is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Senior Contract & Trade Compliance Analyst
Description: Overview * This position will be responsible for contract administration, contract review, terms and conditions review and negotiations, order processing, proposal support, and routine quote preparation as well as execution and monitoring of international customs compliance initiatives and activities set by International Trade Compliance administration responsible for supporting implementation of the corporate trade compliance strategy across the organization while delivering customer service. The Sr Analyst drives trade compliance results through analysis of trade regulations, trade data and overall knowledge with a strong ability to collaborate with functional leaders and teams across the company. * Contracts (Terms and Conditions, NDA’s, Contracts support) for both Geared Solutions (Park City, UT & Macomb, MI) sites. Trade Compliance for Park City only. Responsibilities * Manages customer accounts through contract and order administration using customer portals to retrieve and analyze data for input into our ERP system. *Reviews and analyzes customer contract and purchase order terms to align terms with company standards. *Initiates the Contract Review process by documenting the customer’s order and contract flow-down requirements and routes those requirements to the appropriate internal departments. *Receives and reviews requests for pricing, quotations, and proposals. Provides timely responses to bids in accordance with Triumph Delegation of Authority, company policy, and following Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), Truth in Lending Act (TINA), and certified cost and pricing data standards where applicable. *Responsible for administration of Customer Contracts to ensure the company and the customers are adhering to the agreed terms and conditions including price, delivery, lead-time and other terms and conditions. *Manages and maintains the site Contracts Database. *Prepares documents and analyzes data using Microsoft Word and Excel. *Gathers and provides necessary documentation for both internal and external customers. *Reviews, Creates, and Negotiates T&Cs with customers. *Reviews, Creates, and Negotiates NDAs with customers. *Prepares formal responses/documents for numerous issues (i.e. term for convenience, force majeure claims, contract amendments, etc) *Provides legal analysis on contractual situations case by case to help company determine the best path forward. . * Lead international customs compliance initiative and ensure administrative requirements and data are reported up and across the Corporate Compliance Organization and Business Units. *Communicate with internal stakeholders for awareness of the International Trade regulations and requirements to be met. *Collaboration to support the business in implementing compliant export/import of goods, services, and technical data/technology. *Support organization in the implementation and oversight of International Trade Compliance processes, procedures, and tools by embedding international trade compliance requirements, as necessary. *Lead and support the organization’s implementation of international trade compliance best practices. *Report on key performance indicators to determine performance by organization, broker, freight forwarder and suppliers. *Responsible for capturing and reporting on action plans to improve key performance areas of international trade compliance. *Report to management and team issues of international trade compliance, as necessary. *Ensure the accuracy of data in enterprise systems. Responsible for obtaining and maintaining proper records as required by domestic and international trade regulations. *Lead International Trade Compliance through support to the organization by providing international customs and trade compliance analysis and interpretation related to matters in the region with International Corporate Compliance Leadership oversight. *Draft Export/Import licenses to submit to the government for approval. . *Conduct team trainings to promote compliance understanding and accountability throughout the company. *Review all export and import shipping documents to ensure trade compliance requirements are met and if necessary, hold shipments until compliance is achieved. *Properly audit the license owners and ensure that decrementation of shipments against current export licenses is being maintained as required. *Coordinate with legal reps to provide requested documents in support of compliance efforts. *Lead, develop and perform all administrative international customs compliance requirements for organization and report any significant issues to International Corporate Compliance Leadership. *Have significant understanding, ability to analyze and execution of compliance to customs exit and entry requirements and law. *Provide inputs to the organization for the implementation and oversight of international customs compliance processes, procedures, and tools by embedding customs and trade compliance requirements, as necessary. *Handle trade compliance inquiries from forwarders and brokers. *Help provide training and awareness on Compliance issues to the affiliates in the region. *Assist in ensuring appropriate recordkeeping procedures are met. *Lead issues resolution as it relates to denied party data and provide input to necessary controls for engaging parties in trade transactions. *Fosters positive relationships with internal and external customers. Qualifications * Bachelor’s degree with trade compliance or related experience required. *International Trade/Customs Compliance Experience preferred. *Knowledge of Trade Compliance and Customs management and the effects of trade compliance activities across responsible areas. *5 - 7 years contacts, program management, or related experience required. *Experience working in aerospace manufacturing environment with working knowledge of government contracts preferred. *Excellent computer skills preferably spreadsheets, word processing, database and other applicable software programs. *Excellent analytical skills, with ability to understand financial impact of decisions. *Excellent organizational skills. *Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and excellent time/project management skills. *Results-oriented, with ability to work effectively in a matrix environment. *Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate well-verbally and in writing-with others. *Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills *Excellent regulatory comprehension and understanding

Title: TimeShareWare Senior Business Analyst
Description: * *  SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.* * * *   Job Description* * * *   The business analyst role participates with both client and internal resources in problem definition and analysis. They develop business solutions by gathering and analyzing customer data and making recommendations to improve client operating efficiencies and costs.* * *   Business Analysts drive solutions through a combination of designing high-level functional requirements and business cases that drive new development or enhancement of existing products and services and through training to improve use of current solutions already in place.* *  Able to investigate deviations from expected results and communicated detailed findings to development team*   Identify opportunities to improve the test process based on industry best practice or research*   Solve complex system or data issues encountered during implementation by applying problem solving and analytics skills;*   Provide feedback to product development team that can streamline implementation and enhance the flexibilities of TimeShareware features and functions;*   Be able to execute business validation testing of new features of TimeShareware product suite, including planning and coordination of test activities, communicating with management, and providing guidance to junior members.*   Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of TimeShareware features and functions, and new developments, including data requirements, configuration, transaction mapping, processing and reporting;*   Ability to support client services team as Tier-3 support resource*   Analyzing and documenting required information and data.*   Understanding the technical designs as well as the specifications.*   Ensuring issues are properly documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders* * *   Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.* *

Title: Data Science Manager - Community Health
Description: * About Us *  Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment. *  We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog. *  About the Role *  Community Health is a vital part of Twitch. We build products and solutions that protect our viewers and creators from harm. This role works very closely with the Trust & Safety team whose operations help support and inform the Community Health products; both internal and external-facing. *  We are looking for an experienced manager to lead Analytics for the Community Health organization reporting to the Director of Data Science - Community. This team is responsible for product analytics across the org, helping shape goals, metrics, experimentation and dashboards. This individual will help product, design and engineering leaders make great decisions through data, helping direct the strategy for community health tools at Twitch. *  This position can be located in San Francisco, CA; Irvine, CA; Seattle, WA; New York, NY; and Salt Lake City, UT. *  You Will: * Hire and develop a growing team of analysts *  Establish the vision and roadmap for the team, prioritize the most impactful analysis, and guide the team in solving ambiguous and complex problems. *  Influence our overall product strategy; drive key product decisions through data and insights; set goals and KPIs and identify the right levers to achieve those goals. *  Lead the team to deliver reusable tools that can be productized or used by operational teams. * You Have: * 7+ years of experience (or MS with 5+ years) in data science or analytics roles *  2+ years of people management experience, managing data scientists and data analysts *  Experience in partnering with product teams to define goals, metrics, and experiments *  Track record of guiding teams through unstructured technical problems to deliver business impact *  Full stack experience across data science, analytics, and data engineering *  Graduate (PhD preferred) degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience * Bonus Points * Prior work with Trust & Safety, Risk, or Fraud business units *  Experience with data pipelining from data preparation to analysis to deployment * Perks * Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance *  401(k) *  Maternity & Parental Leave *  Flexible PTO *  Amazon Employee Discount *  Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)*  *  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. *  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. *  The base pay range for this position in Colorado, Connecticut and Washington is $185,400 - $226,600 yr and in New York City is $203,940 - $249,260 yr. Pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on payment and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Applicants should apply via Twitch's internal or external careers site. *  Workers in New York City who perform in-person work or interact with the public in the course of business must show proof they have been fully vaccinated against COVID or request and receive approval for a reasonable accommodation, including medical or religious accommodation. *  Twitch values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.**

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: * Schedule: Mon- Fri Overview: *  Responsible for the maintenance of ongoing data sources, metrics, reports, analyses,* *   dashboards, etc. used to evaluate performance of employees & functions within the credit union such as branches, call centers, mortgage, underwriting, etc.* * *  Supports the analytics information mgmt. team in analyzing results, data sources, forecast, and performance metrics of credit union staff. Analyzes and interprets business intelligence reports. Works with analytics information management team and other IT staff to support managerial and strategic business intelligence needs. Responsibilities:* * *   1) Determines relevant data needs and coordinates with team and other IT staff to fulfill those needs.* * *   a) Work with team to define requirements for views, queries, and tables necessary to support analytic needs that conform and expand data marts and the integrated data warehouse.*   b) Work with management and other staff to assess various reporting needs.*   c) Develops an understanding of underlying corporate data sources and their relationships to support BI development.*   d) Analyze reporting needs and requirements. Assess current reporting in the context of strategic goals and devise plans for delivering the most appropriate reporting solutions to users.* * * *   2) Maintains recurring and ad-hoc business intelligence reports and dashboards.* * * *   a) Extracts operational, performance, statistical and other data from various information systems.*   b) Maintains & answers questions for reporting and analysis needs of the organization,*   primarily to support company performance reporting needs.*   c) Uses various software applications such as desktop tools, spreadsheets, report writing software, statistical software, graphical presentation tools, and BI applications to assemble, manipulate and/ or format data and/or reports.* * *   d) Works within controls to ensure the accuracy, timeliness and confidentiality of all reports, views, dashboards, analyses and data.* * *   e) Trains and supports end users on access of reports.* * *   f) Assists and supports credit union personnel as needed.* * * *   3) Works closely with analytics information manager to interpret and analyze results.* * *   a) Analyzes, interprets and summarizes outputs.*   b) Participates in the interpretation and context of complex business reports .*   c) Runs what-‐if simulations based on varying factors and assumptions.*   d) Identifies exceptions, positive and negative trends and measures that are out of tolerance with established limits and ranges.*   e) Identifies potential concerns based on projections of current trends.*   f) Performs statistical and financial analysis of data and prepares reports for management and other credit union personnel on key observations and findings.* * * *   #IND21*  Qualifications:* *  Must have prior experience working business intelligence tools in large with dashboard design and delivery desired.*  Experience using Tableau Enterprise Reporting to analyze data and report conclusions.* * *   EXPERIENCE:* * One to three years of experience in designing, maintaining or implementing business intelligence reporting solutions*  EDUCATION:* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, or other business related field. Equivalent experience may substitute for education qualifications.*

Title: Digital Marketing Data Analyst-Campaign Delivery
Description: * Job Summary:* *   The Customer Engagement Platform (CEP) team is focused on delivering powerful customer experiences across engagement touch points, by applying data and tools to bring marketing to life. The Campaign Delivery team leads consumer data selection for 1:1 marketing campaigns and manages deployment of direct channel tactics. We accomplish these capabilities with partnerships internally within Disney as well with vendors and software/data suppliers. You will report to the CEP Campaign Delivery Manager III. You will work remotely until in person work resumes.* *  Responsibilities:*  Work with Customer Engagement Partners to determine scope, and priority for messaging efforts*   Build and sustain marketing campaigns end-to-end from data selection, to HTML development, data validation, proofing and campaign deployment using Agile methodology*   Communicate technical options/limitations to partners in an understandable way*   Perform technical analysis, level-of-effort estimation, and development of direct channel communications*   Focus on user efficiencies, solving business/customer issues, invent creative solutions, and ensure data accuracy*   Participate in change management process. Improve communication efforts across relevant partners*   Understand customer and internal partner team needs and translate the requirements into user stories and technical requirements for configuration and development in Adobe Campaign*  Basic Qualifications:*  2+ years of direct experience with marketing campaign list selection processes and direct channel campaign deployment*   2+ years of direct experience with multiple programming languages (Snowflake SQL, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML)*   Business and data analysis experience, including requirements gathering and data exploration/troubleshooting experience*   Experience with email delivery platforms such as Adobe Campaign Manager or other equivalent campaign management platforms*   Experience applying agile marketing methodologies and processes to break long-term goals into short-term wins which encourage learning and shorten time to market*   An understanding of relational database methodology, structures and querying*   Experience with HTML for email and ability to code templates, revise modular layouts and provide both strategic and technical direction to web developers*  Required Education*  Bachelor's degree or equivalent* * This role is considered hybrid, which means the employee will work a portion of their time on-site from a Company designated location and the remainder of their time remotely.*  Additional Information:*  Our Benefits: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits #DPEPFLA DPEPMarketing #LI-MR5*

Title: Technical Operations Analyst
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * At Modernizing Medicine, we look for passionate, innovative, creative Rock Stars! *  *  South Florida Business Journal, Best Places to Work 2021 *   Inc. Magazine Best Workplaces of 2020 *   Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America - 2015 - 2019 *   Marketing Campaign of the Year for Telehealth - Business Intelligence Group's Public Relations & Marketing Excellence Award 2020 *   Best Use of Technology in Customer Service (Gold) - Customer Sales and Service World Awards® - 2019 *   Customer Service Department of the Year (Gold) - Customer Sales and Service World Awards - 2018 *  * *  Modernizing Medicine delivers truly disruptive and transformative products and services that will impact the healthcare industry.
